abstract.p: Jim Florio is emerging as clear choice of newspaper editorial writers over Jon S Corzine in race for New Jersey's Democratic nomination for United States Senate; Star-Ledger of Newark is latest newspaper to endorse Florio (S)

block.p: Jon Corzine is easily winning the spending race, but former Gov. Jim Florio is emerging as the clear choice of newspaper editorial writers in the race for New Jersey's Democratic nomination for the United States Senate.

Jon Corzine is easily winning the spending race, but former Gov. Jim Florio is emerging as the clear choice of newspaper editorial writers in the race for New Jersey's Democratic nomination for the United States Senate.
The Star-Ledger, New Jersey's largest daily newspaper, endorsed Mr. Florio's candidacy yesterday, calling him a ''first-rate congressman and a gutsy governor.''

The paper said the $2.8 billion tax increase that enraged voters was ''probably'' necessary at the time, with the state facing a $600 million deficit and the state constitution requiring a balanced budget.
Last month, Mr. Florio received endorsements from The New York Times, The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Chatham Courier, a weekly Morris County paper.

Thus far, his opponent, Jon Corzine, has been endorsed by The Times of Trenton, a Central New Jersey daily. Yesterday, the paper praised Mr. Corzine for business acumen, ability to work constructively with others and courage to campaign as a liberal.

''He sees government the way F.D.R., Truman, J.F.K., L.B.J. and Humphrey saw it: an instrument for addressing what he calls 'the great unfinished business of social and economic justice,' '' the editorial said.
